abstract: National security officials in both the Bush and Obama administrations have consistently placed biodefense at or near the top of the national-security agenda and have warned of the extreme likelihood of a biological attack since 2001; biodefense experts warn that despite this broad agreement on the nature and likelihood of a biological attack, the United States is woefully unprepared for an attack of this nature.
snippet: Ten years after anthrax attacks, biodefense is busted.

headline.main: How Ready Are We for Bioterrorism?
headline.print_headline: Warning: There's Not Nearly Enough Of This Vaccine To Go Around
